column1: #Text=Bi2O3 (≥98%), CaCO3 (≥99%), SrCO3 (≥99.9%), PbO (≥99%), TiO2 (99.8%), and FeC2O4·2H2O (99%) were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich and used as received.
#Text=The other reagents employed in our experiments were of analytical grade and used without any further purification.
#Text=All the dye solutions were freshly prepared before the experiments in Millipore (Bedford, MA, USA) water.
#Text=Polycrystalline samples of Bi5ATi4FeO18 (A = Ca, Sr, and Pb) were prepared by solid-state reactions.
#Text=For this, stoichiometric quantities of Bi2O3, ACO3 (A = Ca and Sr)/ PbO, TiO2, and FeC2O4·2H2O were thoroughly ground in an agate mortar for 1 h and heated at 780 °C for 2 h.
#Text=Afterward, the powders obtained after initial heating were reground, pelletized, and heated at 1000 °C for 2 h.
